Large Language Models: Methods and Applications / Fall 2024

Updates

  • Welcome to 11-766, which is being offered for the first time this semester! 11-766 expands on the “applications” component of 11-667 Large Language Model Methods and Applications, covering a greater number of applications and in greater detail. We’re excited to welcome you to this new class.


Description

Large Language Models Methods and Applications (11-667) is a graduate-level course that aims to provide a holistic view of the current state of large language models.

Logistics

Class

  • Location: Doherty Hall A302
  • Time: Tuesdays and Thursdays 11 AM - 12:20 PM

Office Hours

  • Daphne: TBD
  • Fernando: TBD
  • TAs: Mondays 1 PM - 2 PM in GHC 5417 and Thursdays 11 AM -12 PM in Wean Hall 3110, starting in Week 2

Contacting the Instructors

For all questions related to course materials, please post to Piazza.

For questions about grades, accomodations, or any other specific situation, reach out to the instructor email: llms-11-766@andrew.cmu.edu. Any course-related emails sent to other addresses will be ignored.
